H0.text: Distance is what a light year is used to measure in space, as demonstrated by Voyager 1's 1977 launch from Earth and its over‑500‑year travel time to cover one light year.

H1.text: Energy is what a light year is used to measure in space, based on the information that Jesus learned Voyager 1 was launched from Earth in 1977 and will take more than 500 years to travel 1 light year.

H2.text: Force is a light year used to measure in space, as illustrated by Voyager 1 launched from Earth in 1977, which will take more than 500 years to travel 1 light year.

H3.text: Time is what a light year is used to measure in space, as shown by Voyager 1’s launch from Earth in 1977 and its projected travel time of more than 500 years to cover 1 light year.

A4.text: The light-year is most often used when expressing distances to stars and other distances on a galactic scale

A5.text: Despite its inclusion of the word 'year', the term should not be misinterpreted as a unit of time
